title: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
meta_description: Discover wine calories in a bottle: a standard 750 ml has about 625 kcal, plus carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for red, white, or sweet types.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine, 12% ABV, no added sugars or sulfites beyond typical.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (red/white), alcohol content, sweetness, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine provides ~625 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sweet wine (e.g., dessert style, higher residual sugar)
Sparkling wine (e.g., brut champagne, similar ABV)

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine.

faqs.q: Wine calories in a bottle vs. a glass?
faqs.a: A bottle (750 ml) has ~625 kcal; a standard 150 ml glass has ~125 kcal.

faqs.q: Do all wines have the same calories?
faqs.a: Noâ€”sweet wines add 100-300 kcal per bottle from sugars; ABV affects it too.

faqs.q: What contributes most to wine calories in a bottle?
faqs.a: Primarily alcohol (7 kcal/g), with minor carbs from grapes.
Similar to red: ~600-650 kcal for dry white in a 750 ml bottle.
